subject: Re: Can I set max-memory in runtime?
msgSnippet: ... My cache seem to have problem, it will throw OOME occasionally. Actually I think I know what is the problem and I ve fix this already. I just try to see if
messageBody:
Chris Dollin wrote:

>On Wednesday 09 March 2005 10:30, Carfield Yim wrote:
>
>
>>I try to create a testcase which simulate outofmemoryerror , I can do
>>this if I set the -Xmx parameter to a very low value. However, I would
>>like make it independence from java parameter setting.
>>
>>Anyone know can I set max-memory in runtime? Or can anyone give me
>>better suggestion about this?
>>
>>
>
>What are you trying to do in your test?
>
>Could you just throw an OOME?
>
>
My cache seem to have problem, it will throw OOME occasionally. Actually
I think I know what is the problem and I've fix this already. I just try
to see if I can simulate it at testcase and check it at daily unittest run.
